alert.note: Alert for Jones (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 11:43PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, northwestern Jones. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1140 PM CDT, Radar indicated showers and isolated thunderstorms with moderate to heavy rain across northwestern Jones County. Rainfall of 2.5 to 3 inches has already fallen across northwestern Jones County. Additional rainfall of one- half to three quarters of an inch is expected through 1245 AM. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anson, Hamlin, Neinda, Tuxedo and The Intersection Of Us-180 And Ranch Road 126. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... crossings along County Road 141. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
